item.title: Trump team's cross-examination expected to hone in on Michael Cohen's history of lying
item.description: Star witness Michael Cohen will resume testimony today about making a $130,000 hush money payment to adult film actor Stormy Daniels to suppress her story about an alleged affair with Donald Trump.

media:content.media:text: Courtroom sketch of Michael Cohen in court
media:content.media:description: Michael Cohen is questioned by prosecutor Susan Hoffinger before Justice Juan Merchan while a reimbursement check is shown on screen, as former U.S. President Donald Trump and his lawyer Emil Bove look on Tuesday, May 14, 2024.

item.title: Michael Cohen details Trump's role in his repeated lies about hush money payment
item.dc:creator: Adam Reiss and Jillian Frankel and Gary Grumbach and Dareh Gregorian and Ryan Nobles and Vaughn Hillyard and Katherine Koretski
item.description: Cohen is expected to delve into payments he said he received from Trump in return for hush money paid to Stormy Daniels in the closing days of the 2016 campaign.

media:content.media:text: Image: Michael Cohen
media:content.media:description: Michael Cohen leaves his apartment building in New York, Tuesday, May 14, 2024.

media:content.media:text: Rep. Byron Donalds, R-Fla., North Dakota Governor Doug Burgum, House Speaker Mike Johnson, former presidential candidate Vivek Ramaswamy and Rep. Cory Mills, R-Fla., listen as former President Donald Trump speaks to reporters
media:content.media:description: From left, Rep. Byron Donalds, R-Fla., North Dakota Governor Doug Burgum, House Speaker Mike Johnson, former presidential candidate Vivek Ramaswamy and Rep. Cory Mills, R-Fla., listen as Trump speaks to reporters Tuesday. Trump's son Eric Trump and his wife, Republican National Committee co-chair Lara Trump, are at upper right.

item.title: Trump's vice presidential contenders show their support — and loyalty — in court
item.dc:creator: Alec Hernández
item.description: Former President Donald Trump’s vice presidential prospects, like JD Vance and Doug Burgum, have turned his New York trial into a proving ground.

media:content.media:text: JD Vance looks on as Donald Trump speaks.
media:content.media:description: Sen. JD Vance of Ohio looks on as Donald Trump speaks at Manhattan Criminal Court on Monday.

item.title: Johnson defends Trump while attending the criminal hush money trial
item.description: House Speaker Mike Johnson condemned the criminal hush money trial against former President Donald Trump and claimed the charges were politically motivated.

media:content.media:title: Johnson defends Trump while attending the criminal hush money trial
media:content.media:description: House Speaker Mike Johnson condemned the criminal hush money trial against former President Donald Trump and claimed the charges were politically motivated.

item.title: 8 dead and 8 critically injured after bus carrying farmworkers crashes in Florida
item.dc:creator: Marlene Lenthang
item.description: Eight people are dead and 40 were hospitalized after a bus carrying farm workers crashed and overturned early Tuesday morning in north central Florida, officials said.

media:content.media:text: Emergency workers at the scene of a fatal bus crash
media:content.media:description: Emergency workers at the scene of a fatal bus crash carrying laborers that overturned Tuesday morning, May 14, 2024 in Marion CountyFla.

item.title: Recent Israeli troop movements seen by U.S. suggest Rafah attack could happen soon
item.dc:creator: Monica Alba and Courtney Kube and Gabe Gutierrez and Phil Helsel and Raf Sanchez and Reuters
item.description: The U.S. has seen recent troop movement that indicates Israel could expand operations in Rafah soon, but has not made a formal assessment about whether a full-scale invasion is imminent, according to two U.S. officials.

media:content.media:text: Israeli Strikes Destroy Buildings In Rafah
media:content.media:description: Children watch as smoke billows from buildings during Israeli strikes east of Rafah in the southern Gaza Strip on May 13, 2024.

item.title: Silver lining for consumers: Food price growth has gone flat and other prices are falling
item.dc:creator: Rob Wile
item.description: Price growth in many key consumer categories has slowed considerably or ceased altogether — but that has done little to dent consumer worries as the costs of housing and other services have continued to climb.

media:content.media:text: A customer shops at an H-E-B grocery store in Austin, Texas
media:content.media:description: A customer shops at an H-E-B grocery store in Austin, Texas, in February 2023.

item.title: Biden moves ahead on China tariff hikes that includes 100% increase on EVs
item.dc:creator: Gabe Gutierrez and Rae Wang
item.description: President Joe Biden will announce Tuesday that his administration is raising tariffs on $18 billion of Chinese exports, including electric vehicles, as the White House tries to fight what it says are unfair trade practices by its global competitor.

media:content.media:text: cina economy ev evs electric cars vehicles transport parking lot
media:content.media:description: An aerial view of electric cars for export stacked at the international container terminal of Taicang Port in Suzhou, in China's eastern Jiangsu Province, on April 16, 2024.

item.title: King Charles unveils his first portrait since coronation at Buckingham Palace
item.dc:creator: Mirna Alsharif
item.description: Britain’s King Charles III unveiled a new portrait of himself at Buckingham Palace Tuesday.

media:content.media:text: King Charles III and Queen Camilla at the unveiling of artist Jonathan Yeo's portrait.
media:content.media:description: King Charles III and Queen Camilla at the unveiling of artist Jonathan Yeo's portrait of the King at Buckingham Palace, London, on Tuesday.

media:content.media:text: Artist Jonathan Yeo in front of the portrait of King Charles.
media:content.media:description: Artist Jonathan Yeo on Tuesday.

item.title: 9-year-old boy narrowly missed in drive-by shooting caught on home security camera
item.dc:creator: Patrick Smith
item.description: A 9-year-old boy came within inches of being hit by stray bullets while he sat in his house in Fort Worth, Texas, when a drive-by shooting took place at an apartment complex earlier this month.

media:content.media:text: Harrowing footage shows the moment when bullets came through the wall and flew past a nine-year-old boy during a drive-by shooting at a Fort Worth apartment complex in Texas.
media:content.media:description: Harrowing footage shows the moment when bullets came through the wall and flew past a nine-year-old boy during a drive-by shooting at a Fort Worth apartment complex in Texas.

item.title: Maryland Democrats battle for party's future — and control of the Senate
item.dc:creator: Julie Tsirkin and Kate Santaliz and Bridget Bowman and Ben Kamisar
item.description: The Maryland Democratic Senate primary between Angela Alsobrooks and David Trone has been affected by Republican Larry Hogan's decision to run for the seat.

media:content.media:text: A side by side split image of Angela Alsobrooks and David Trone
media:content.media:description: Prince George's County Executive Angela Alsobrooks and Rep. David Trone, D-Md.

media:content.media:text: Image: Maryland Gov. Larry Hogan
media:content.media:description: Then-Maryland Gov. Larry Hogan addresses supporters at the Maryland statehouse on Jan. 10, 2023, in Annapolis, Md.

item.title: Manhunt launched in France after 2 prison guards are killed in inmate escape
item.dc:creator: Nancy Ing and Elie Petit and Patrick Smith
item.description: A manhunt has been launched for armed attackers who killed two prison officers and injured three more while breaking a prisoner out of a van in northern France.

media:content.media:text: A forensic investigator at the site of a ramming attack in France
media:content.media:description: A forensic investigator at the site of a ramming attack Tuesday in Incarville, northern France.

item.title: Biden delivers remarks on investing and the job market
item.description: Watch live coverage as President Joe Biden delivers remarks on American investments and the labor market.

media:content.media:title: Biden delivers remarks on investing and the job market
media:content.media:description: Watch live coverage as President Joe Biden delivers remarks on American investments and the labor market.

item.title: U.N.'s new breakdown of Gaza death toll sparks confusion and anger
item.dc:creator: Chantal Da Silva and Nigel Chiwaya
item.description: Global health officials say the number of women and children killed in Gaza has not been revised down after new details published by the United Nations sparka an outcry.

media:content.media:text: Palestinians recover human remains at the grounds of Al-Shifa hospital, Gaza's largest hospital, on April 8, 2024.
media:content.media:description: Palestinians recover human remains at the grounds of Al-Shifa hospital, Gaza's largest hospital, on April 8, 2024.

item.title: Prosecutors ask judge to order Steve Bannon to report to prison
item.dc:creator: Michael Kosnar and Dan Mangan, CNBC and Summer Concepcion and Rebecca Shabad
item.description: Federal prosecutors requested U.S. District Judge Carl Nichols order former Trump adviser Steve Bannon to begin serving his four-month prison sentence after an appeals court last week upheld his conviction on contempt of Congress charges.

media:content.media:text: Steve Bannon at CPAC
media:content.media:description: Steve Bannon speaks at the Conservative Political Action Conference on Feb. 24.

item.title: Fed Chair Jerome Powell says inflation has been higher than thought and expects rates to hold steady
item.dc:creator: Jeff Cox, CNBC
item.description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell reiterated Tuesday that inflation is falling more slowly than expected and will keep the central bank on hold for an extended period.

media:content.media:text: Jerome Powell speaks during a news conference
media:content.media:description: Federal Reserve Board Chair Jerome Powell at the Federal Reserve in Washington on May 1.

item.title: Obituary for Eminem alter ego Slim Shady appears in Detroit Free Press Newspaper
item.dc:creator: Noah Osborne
item.description: A fake obituary was posted for Slim Shady ahead of Eminem's upcoming 12th LP slated to be released this summer, “The Death of Slim Shady (Coup De Grâce).”

media:content.media:text: Eminem performs during halftime at the Super Bowl in 2022.

item.dc:creator: Randi Richardson, TODAY

item.title: Nemo's Eurovision win fires up Swiss advocates for nonbinary rights
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.description: Swiss advocates for nonbinary rights hailed Nemo’s victory in Eurovision Song Contest, urging authorities to enable official recognition of nonbinary people.

media:content.media:text: Swiss singer Nemo
media:content.media:description: Swiss singer Nemo at Eurovision Song Contest on May 11, 2024, in Malmo, Sweden.

item.title: Amazon’s Summer Beauty Haul sale is here — and you can even make money for spending
item.dc:creator: Bianca Alvarez
item.description: Amazon is hosting its annual Summer Beauty Haul savings event. Shop the best deals across all beauty categories for an entire week.

media:content.media:text: We curated the best Amazon deals on hair care, skin care, body care and more.
media:content.media:description: We curated the best Amazon deals on hair care, skin care, body care and more.

item.title: Colorado Avalanche player suspended for 6 months just one hour before playoff loss
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.description: Colorado Avalanche forward Valeri Nichushkin was suspended for at least six months without pay and placed in stage 3 of the league’s player assistance program before Game 4 on Monday night of a second-round series with Dallas.

media:content.media:text: Valeri Nichushkin celebrating a goal
media:content.media:description: Colorado Avalanche forward Valeri Nichushkin.

item.title: Latinas juggle gender rules and 'dueling cultural pressures,' survey shows
item.dc:creator: Nicole Acevedo
item.description: Most Latinas say they feel pressure to succeed at work and provide for their loved ones at home while also juggling cultural expectations such as doing housework and living up to beauty standards, a Pew Research Center study found.

media:content.media:text: National Survey On Latinas
media:content.media:description: A new analysis by Pew Research Center explores Latinas' life experiences, their views of pressures they face to succeed at home and work, and where they find joy.
